message.content:
Below is a worked‐example of how one can interpret and build the scene step by step.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Overall Layout
There are two separate structures:

• Left Structure:  
  – Bottom/1st Layer: Two small yellow rectangular blocks side by side.  
  – 2nd Layer: One red “curved” block on top of the yellow blocks (its curved face outward).  
  – On the sides/back near this red block are two orange triangular wedges (one leaning left, one leaning right).  
  – 3rd Layer: A short green rectangular block spanning across the top of the red block.  
  – 4th Layer: Two blue cubes side by side on top.  

• Right Structure:  
  – Bottom/1st Layer: A short green rectangular block serving as the base.  
  – 2nd Layer: An orange cylinder, oriented vertically, standing on the green base.  
  – 3rd Layer: Another short green rectangular block on top of the cylinder, forming a platform.  
  – 4th Layer: Two tall green rectangular blocks standing side by side on that platform, creating a “U” shape around the center.  

■ Block Counts and Layers
• Left structure uses 8 blocks in 4 layers (plus the two wedges flanking the middle).  
• Right structure uses 5 blocks in (effectively) 4 layers (green base → cylinder → green platform → two tall greens).  

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2)  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Below are the dictionary indices chosen so that color/shape/orientation match exactly (no re‐orientations allowed):

● Left Structure
  1)  Two yellow rectangular blocks:  index 7 (used twice)
  2)  One red curved block:           index 1
  3)  One short green rectangular:    index 4
  4)  Two blue cubes:                index 2 (used twice)
  5)  Two orange wedges:             index 14 and index 16  
     (one leaning left, one leaning right)

● Right Structure
  1)  One short green rectangular base:  index 4
  2)  One orange vertical cylinder:       index 9
  3)  One short green rectangular top:    index 4
  4)  Two tall green rectangular blocks:  index 5 (used twice)

Note that index 4 and index 5 are each used multiple times.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Below is one possible build order (you may of course vary the exact order slightly as long as the final arrangement matches):

{
  Step1:  Move block with index 7
  Step2:  Move block with index 7
  Step3:  Move block with index 1
  Step4:  Move block with index 14
  Step5:  Move block with index 16
  Step6:  Move block with index 4
  Step7:  Move block with index 2
  Step8:  Move block with index 2
  Step9:  Move block with index 4
  Step10: Move block with index 9
  Step11: Move block with index 4
  Step12: Move block with index 5
  Step13: Move block with index 5
}

Following those steps in order will recreate the two structures exactly as shown in the main image.
